thread.title: Smoked mackerel pâté recipe

author: Simon Stallard
title: Smoked mackerel pâté recipe
text: SERVES 4 INGREDIENTS 8 fillets of smoked mackerel 100ml double cream 1 lemon (zest and juice) 4 tbsp crème fraîche a 2.5cm piece of fresh horseradish, peeled and finely grated 1 tbsp chopped dill 1 tbsp chopped tarragon METHOD You can buy fresh horseradish from a good food store or forage it yourself – it grows in abundance in this country. Look for leaves similar to dock leaves that have that distinct horseradish smell when scrunched. It is the root that you are after. Blitz seven smoked mackerel fillets in a food processor with the cream and lemon until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and fold in the crème fraîche, horseradish and herbs. Flake in the remaining fish and mix through for texture. Season to taste and serve with warm flatbreads. This is also lovely with chopped capers stirred in or a few pieces of pickled cucumber served alongside it.
